definition: (economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Customarily, the austerity measures have to be in place as the aid package takes effect.
sentences.chinese: 在援助计划生效的同时，紧缩措施通常必须到位。

sentences.english: Gas with the piston movement from right to left and is gradually compressed.
sentences.chinese: 气体随着活塞从右往左运动而逐渐被紧缩。

sentences.english: Deflation can be long-lasting and have a chilling effect on stock markets.
sentences.chinese: 通货紧缩可能会持续很长时间，给股市浇上一盆冷水。

sentences.english: It is hoped and expected that the tighter policy environment will also dampen the excessively high rates of investment.
sentences.chinese: 市场希望透过紧缩政策将能有效调节过热的投资气氛。

sentences.english: THE bubble that caused a global recession has been a long time deflating.
sentences.chinese: 引发全球经济衰退的泡沫就是长期的通货紧缩。

sentences.english: As pharmacy chains face squeezes on profit margins, the use of techs is growing.
sentences.chinese: 配药连锁店由于利润幅度紧缩，使用的技工越来越多。

sentences.english: You can spot reduce for tight abs or toned arms.
sentences.chinese: 你能恰好减肥到拥有紧缩的腹肌和优美的手臂。

sentences.english: In fact, the macro-tightening policy has not publicized the outside world so strict.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，宏观紧缩政策并没有外界宣传的这么严格。

sentences.english: China has turned decisively from being a deflationary to an inflationary factor in the world economy.
sentences.chinese: 中国已经决然地从世界经济的紧缩因素变成通胀因素。

sentences.english: The reasons for the new American austerity are subtler, but not shocking.
sentences.chinese: 美国紧缩新政的原因更为微妙，但并不令人吃惊。

sentences.english: Abdominal distension has been described as the most common presenting symptom in children with constrictive pericarditis.
sentences.chinese: 小儿患有紧缩性心包膜炎通常以腹胀为最常见之症状。

sentences.english: Employment will shrink in a financial spiral of economic austerity.
sentences.chinese: 在经济紧缩，金融得道升天的情况下，就业将很严峻。

sentences.english: When the crunch-card turns up, a bail-out card offers a way out.
sentences.chinese: 出现“紧缩”牌时，“保释”牌排忧解围。

sentences.english: Mr Zapatero wisely said this week that he would stick to his guns.
sentences.chinese: 本周萨帕特罗明智地表示将坚持紧缩措施。

sentences.english: Finger pull-tab for easy, low-down tightening.
sentences.chinese: 手指拔出标签，方便，低了紧缩政策。

sentences.english: Cameron strikes a Churchillian tone when he talks about the nation’s austerity plans.
sentences.chinese: 卡梅伦在谈到国家的紧缩计划时用的是丘吉尔的论调。

definition: to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
